body_html: Thanks for the fast answer. I think I've solved my problem. It wasn't the graphics card but the optimization algorithm that was responsible for the errors. I changed it from tf.train.GradientDescentOptimizer() with tf.train.exponential_decay() to tf.train.AdamOptimizer(). Now I don't get any more NaN errors.
body_text: Thanks for the fast answer. I think I've solved my problem. It wasn't the graphics card but the optimization algorithm that was responsible for the errors. I changed it from tf.train.GradientDescentOptimizer() with tf.train.exponential_decay() to tf.train.AdamOptimizer(). Now I don't get any more NaN errors.
body: Thanks for the fast answer. I think I've solved my problem. It wasn't the graphics card but the optimization algorithm that was responsible for the errors. I changed it from `tf.train.GradientDescentOptimizer()` with `tf.train.exponential_decay()` to `tf.train.AdamOptimizer()`. Now I don't get any more NaN errors.
